item.title: Frezanda add a quote by Brian Selznick
item.description: "I like to imagine that the world is one big machine. You know, machines never have any extra parts. They have the exact number and type of parts they need. So I figure if the entire world is a big machine, I have to be here for some reason. And that means you have to be here for some reason, too." -- Brian Selznick

item.title: Frezanda add a quote by Tahereh Mafi
item.description: "Hope is hugging me, holding me in its arms, wiping away my tears and telling me that today and tomorrow and two days from now I will be just fine and I'm so delirious I actually dare to believe it." -- Tahereh Mafi

item.title: Frezanda add a quote by Tahereh Mafi
item.description:
"I only know now that the scientists are wrong.
The world is flat.
I know because I was tossed right off the edge and I've been trying to hold on for 17 years. I've been trying to climb back up for 17 years but it's nearly impossible to beat gravity when no one is willing to give you a hand." -- Tahereh Mafi

item.title: Frezanda add a quote by Tahereh Mafi
item.description: "Hope is a pocket of possibility. I'm holding it in my hand." -- Tahereh Mafi

item.title: Frezanda add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description: "And so, does the destination matter? Or is it the path we take? I declare that no accomplishment has substance nearly as great as the road used to achieve it. We are not creatures of destinations. It is the journey that shapes us. Our callused feet, our backs strong from carrying the weight of our travels, our eyes open with the fresh delight of experiences lived." -- Brandon Sanderson

item.title: Frezanda add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description: "In the end, all men die. How you lived will be far more important to the Almighty than what you accomplished." -- Brandon Sanderson

item.title: Frezanda add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description: "To lack feeling is to be dead, but to act on every feeling is to be a child." -- Brandon Sanderson

item.title: Frezanda add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description: "The purpose of a storyteller is not to tell you how to think, but to give you questions to think upon." -- Brandon Sanderson

item.title: Frezanda add a quote by A.S. King
item.description: "True love includes equal parts good and bad, but true loves sticks around and doesn't run off to Vegas with a podiatrist." -- A.S. King

item.title: Frezanda add a quote by A.S. King
item.description: "I miss him so much, but it's confusing, because I missed him long before he was dead, and that's the bitch of it all. I missed him long before he was dead." -- A.S. King

item.title: Frezanda add a quote by Jenny B. Jones
item.description: "When I get to heaven one day, I'm going to ask God how it's possible that time moves so much quicker on the weekends than on school days." -- Jenny B. Jones

item.title: Frezanda add a quote by Jenny B. Jones
item.description: "I loved him for the dad he didn't have to be. But was." -- Jenny B. Jones

item.title: Frezanda add a quote by Alyxandra Harvey
item.description: "Tucking my nose into a book makes me completely oblivious to my surroundings. I would have made a terrible spy in the army--the first person to hand me a novel would have been able to shoot my head clean off without me noticing." -- Alyxandra Harvey

item.title: Frezanda add a quote by George MacDonald
item.description: "Man finds it hard to get what he wants, because he does not want the best; God finds it hard to give, because He would give the best, and man will not take it." -- George MacDonald

item.title: Frezanda add a quote by George MacDonald
item.description: "Seeing is not believing - it is only seeing." -- George MacDonald

item.title: Frezanda add a quote by George MacDonald
item.description: "People must believe what they can, and those who believe more must not be hard upon those who believe less. I doubt if you would have believed it all yourself if you hadn't seen some of it." -- George MacDonald

item.title: Frezanda add a quote by George MacDonald
item.description: "No story ever really ends, and I think I know why. " -- George MacDonald

item.title: Frezanda add a quote by George MacDonald
item.description: "Come, then, affliction, if my Father wills, and be my frowning friend. A friend that frowns is better than a smiling enemy. " -- George MacDonald

item.title: Frezanda add a quote by Gary D. Schmidt
item.description: "Books can ignite fires in your mind, because they carry ideas for kindling, and art for matches." -- Gary D. Schmidt

item.title: Frezanda add a quote by Gary D. Schmidt
item.description: "The world is Trouble...and Grace. That is all there is." -- Gary D. Schmidt

item.title: Frezanda add a quote by Gary D. Schmidt
item.description:
"You know, there are good reasons to learn how to read. Poetry isn't one of them. I mean, so what if two roads go two ways in a wood? So what? Who cares if it made all that big a difference? What difference? And why should I have to guess what the difference is? Isn't that what he's supposed to say?
Why can't poets just say what they want to say and then shut up?" -- Gary D. Schmidt

item.title: Frezanda add a quote by Gary D. Schmidt
item.description: "She came over and looked at the picture. Then she took my hand. You know what that feels like? Like what the astronauts will feel when they step onto the moon for the very first time." -- Gary D. Schmidt

item.title: Frezanda add a quote by Gary D. Schmidt
item.description: "On Saturday mornings during deliveries, I'd practice picking out new words in Jane Eyre, sounding out the ones that needed sounding out—and I'm not lying, there were plenty. "'A new servitude! There is something in that,' I soliloquized." I mean, who talks like that? Do you know how long it takes to sound out a word like soliloquized? And even after you do, you have no idea what the stupid word means except that it probably just means "said," which is what stupid Charlotte Brontë should have said in the first place. When I delivered Mrs. Mason's groceries, she saw that I had Jane Eyre stuck under my arm. "Oh," she said, "that was my favorite novel in school." "It was?" I soliloquized." -- Gary D. Schmidt

item.title: Frezanda add a quote by Neal Shusterman
item.description: "In a perfect world everything would be either black or white, right or wrong, and everyone would know the difference. But this isn't a perfect world. The problem is people who think it is." -- Neal Shusterman

item.title: Frezanda add a quote by Neal Shusterman
item.description: "I'd rather be partly great than entirely useless." -- Neal Shusterman

item.title: Frezanda add a quote by Neal Shusterman
Frezanda add a quote by Neal Shusterman
Frezanda add a quote by Neal Shusterman
item.description: "[Dad] So your intentions were good. That's what matters. [Anthony] But isn't, like, the road to hell paved with good intentions? Yeah, well, so's the road to heaven. And if you spend too much time thinking about where those good intentions are taking you, you know where you end up? Jersey? I was thinking 'nowhere,' but you get the point." -- Neal Shusterman

item.title: Frezanda add a quote by Neal Shusterman
item.description: "Life is like a bad haircut. At first it looks awful, then you kind of get used to it, and before you know it, it it grows out and you gotta get another haircut that maybe won't be so bad, unless of course you keep going to SuperClips, where the hairstylists are so terrible they oughta be using safety scissors, and when they're done you look like your head got caught in a ceiling fan. So life goes on, good haircut, bad haircut, until finally you go bald, and it don't matter no more. I told this wisdom to my mother, and she said I oughta put it in a book, then burn it. Some people just can't appreciate the profound." -- Neal Shusterman

item.title: Frezanda add a quote by Neal Shusterman
item.description: "What's the point of living if you're going to hate the world? Guard your heart if you have to, but don't shut it away." -- Neal Shusterman
